LocaleResource.Value: The display order of this language. 1 represents the top of the list.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Languages.Fields.Rtl.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Check to enable right-to-left support for this language. The active theme should support RTL (have appropriate CSS style file). And it affects only public store.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Languages.Fields.UniqueSeoCode.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: The unique two letter SEO code. It's used to generate URLs like 'http://www.yourStore.com/en/' when you have more than one published language. 'SEO friendly URLs with multiple languages' option should also be enabled.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Languages.Fields.UniqueSeoCode.Length
LocaleResource.Value: Two letter SEO code should be 2 characters long.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Languages.Fields.UniqueSeoCode.Required

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Plugins.Description.Step3
LocaleResource.Value: Scroll down through the list of plugins to find the newly installed plugin.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Plugins.Description.Step4
LocaleResource.Value: Click on the 'Install' link to install the plugin.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Plugins.Description.Step5
LocaleResource.Value: Note: If you're running nopCommerce in medium trust, then it's recommended to clear your \Plugins\bin\ directory

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.EnableCssBundling.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Enable to combine (bundle) multiple CSS files into a single file. Don't enable if you're running nopCommerce in web farms or Windows Azure. It also doesn't work in virtual IIS directories. Note that this functionality requires significant server resources (not recommended to use with cheap shared hosting plans).

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.EnableJsBundling.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Enable to combine (bundle) multiple JavaScript files into a single file. Don't enable if you're running nopCommerce in web farms or Windows Azure. Note that this functionality requires significant server resources (not recommended to use with cheap shared hosting plans).

LocaleResource.Value: Enable XSRF protection for admin area

LocaleResource.Value: Check to enable XSRF protection for admin area.

LocaleResource.Value: Enable XSRF protection for public store

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.EnableXSRFProtectionForPublicStore.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Check to enable XSRF protection for public store.

LocaleResource.Value: The encryption private key used for storing sensitive data.

LocaleResource.Value: The new encryption key is the same as the old one

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.ForceSslForAllPages
LocaleResource.Value: Force SSL for all site pages

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.ForceSslForAllPages.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: By default not all site pages are SSL protected. Check to force SSL for the entire site. This setting is useful only when you have SSL enabled on your store details pages.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.FullTextSettings.Disabled
LocaleResource.Value: Full-Text support has been disabled successfully.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.FullTextSettings.Enabled
LocaleResource.Value: Full-Text support has been enabled successfully.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.FullTextSettings.NoiseWords
LocaleResource.Value: To prevent a full-text index from becoming bloated, Microsoft SQL Server has a mechanism that discards commonly occurring words that do not help the search. These words are called noise words, or stop words. Noise words are listed in the locale specific noise word files. For example, in the English locale, words such as "a," "and," "is," and "the" are in the English noise word file and are left out of the full-text index since they are empirically known to be useless to a search. Please contact your SQL Server administrator to get more information about it.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.FullTextSettings.NotSupported
LocaleResource.Value: Full-Text is not supported by your database

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.FullTextSettings.Supported
LocaleResource.Value: Full-Text is supported by your database

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.GenerateProductMetaDescription.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: When enabled, product META descriptions will be automatically generated (if not specified on the product details page) based on product short description.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.GooglePlusLink.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Specify your Google+ page URL. Leave empty if you have no such page.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.HoneypotEnabled.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Check to enable honeypot technique for registration page.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.InvoiceFooterTextColumn1.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Enter the text that will appear at the bottom of generated invoices (left column).

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.InvoiceFooterTextColumn2.Hint

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.LoadAllLocaleRecordsOnStartup
LocaleResource.Value: Load all locale resources on startup

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.LoadAllLocaleRecordsOnStartup.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: When enabled, all locale resources will be loaded on application startup. The application start will be slower, but then all pages could be opened much faster.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.LoadAllLocalizedPropertiesOnStartup
LocaleResource.Value: Load all localized properties on startup

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.LoadAllLocalizedPropertiesOnStartup.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: When enabled, all localized properties (such as localized product properties) will be loaded on application startup. The application start will be slower, but then all pages could be opened much faster. It's used only when you have two or more languages enabled. Not recommended to enable when you have a large catalog (several thousand localized entities).

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.LoadAllUrlRecordsOnStartup
LocaleResource.Value: Load all search engine friendly names on startup

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.LoadAllUrlRecordsOnStartup.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: When enabled, all slugs (search engine friendly names) will be loaded on application startup. The application start will be slower, but then all pages could be opened much faster. Not recommended to enable when you have a large catalog (several thousand entities).

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.OpenGraphMetaTags.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Check to generate Open Graph META tags on the product details page.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.PageTitleSeoAdjustment.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: Select a page title SEO adjustment. For example, generated page title could be (PAGE NAME | YOURSTORE.COM) instead of (YOURSTORE.COM | PAGE NAME).

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.Settings.GeneralCommon.PdfLetterPageSizeEnabled.Hint
LocaleResource.Value: If checked, uses Letter page size for PDF documents. Uses A4 page size if unchecked.

LocaleResource.Name: EUCookieLaw.Description
LocaleResource.Value: On 26 May 2011, the rules about cookies on websites changed. This site uses cookies. One or more of the cookies we use is essential for parts of this website to operate and has already been set. You may delete and block all cookies from this site, but parts of the site will not work. To find out more about cookies used on this website and how to delete cookies, see our privacy policy

LocaleResource.Value: Cookies help us deliver our services. By using our services, you agree to our use of cookies.
